Static Site Generators

I have already mentioned that github pages can host static webpages, and Jekyll was the first static site generator I encountered. Jekyll is powered by Ruby. And I started searching for similar static site generators powered in other languages, such as Python, JS, Clojure and others.

I came across several such (open-source) static site generators on the web, and a list is found here. I do hope to test out some of these new site generators. Although it is not possible to test each of the features, I do hope to test one site generator per each language (Python, Clojure, JS, Node.js etc).

Maintained by Raghu Nandan Chilukuri
